ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Bilateral sensorineural hearing loss
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Long-standing, progressive history; audiometry confirms bilateral sloping moderate-to-severe SNHL; consistent with presbycusis.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Tinnitus
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Patient reports bothersome buzzing (7/10); likely associated with hearing loss and medications.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Dizziness/Imbalance
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Intermittent off-balance sensation; likely multifactorial due to polypharmacy, COPD, and hypothyroidism; non-vertiginous.

ordered_list.rationale_short: Re-evaluate hearing thresholds given reported difficulties and 2-year interval since last test.
Assess speech-in-noise ability to quantify functional deficit and aid in counseling.
Quantify awareness and bothersomeness of tinnitus.
Verify hearing aid fitting to ensure targets are met and dynamic range is addressed.
Assess dynamic range to ensure amplification does not exceed uncomfortable levels.
Ensure maximum output of hearing aids does not exceed patient's loudness discomfort levels.
Verify extended-wear hearing aid fitting since REM was not possible.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Re-evaluation confirms bilateral sloping moderate-to-severe SNHL, slightly progressed from 2 years ago. Dynamic range is reduced (LDLs 85-90 dB HL). Speech-in-noise performance is severely compromised but improves significantly with visual cues. Tinnitus is a significant concern.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Bilateral sloping moderate-to-severe SNHL. Right thresholds 35-80 dB HL; Left thresholds 40-85 dB HL. LDLs 85-90 dB HL.

tests.name: QuickSIN
tests.result_summary: Severe SNR loss. 19.5 dB SNR loss at 65 dB HL (auditory only); improves to 5.5 dB SNR loss with visual cues.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Hearing aid fitting verification. Initial slim-tube BTE fitting provided insufficient gain. Switch to RIC devices with power domes achieved target gain.

tests.name: Real Ear Measurements (REM)
tests.result_summary: Slim-tube BTE failed targets. RIC with power domes met NAL-NL1 targets for 50, 65, and 80 dB SPL inputs.

tests.name: RESR90
tests.result_summary: Measured to ensure output did not exceed reduced dynamic range.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: 2-week follow-up. One hearing aid lost and replaced. Discussion regarding wearing aids during sleep.

tests.name: Hearing Aid Check
tests.result_summary: Lost aid replaced. Counseling on retention and sleep use provided.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: 2-week follow-up. Tinnitus significantly subsided. Patient reconnecting with family. Dexterity issues with RIC insertion/removal noted.

tests.name: Subjective Report
tests.result_summary: Tinnitus improved. Dexterity issues with RICs causing frustration.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Discussion of alternatives due to dexterity issues. Switched to extended-wear devices. Subjective verification used.

tests.name: Extended-Wear Hearing Aid Fitting
tests.result_summary: Switched to extended-wear devices. Patient reported 'echoic' voice; resolved by reducing low-frequency gain.

tests.name: Aided sound-field measurements
tests.result_summary: Used for verification as REM was not possible with deep insertion.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: 1-week follow-up. Patient and family delighted with ease of use. No programming changes needed.
1-week later. Left device removed due to pain/redness caused by coughing episode dislodging the device. Ear canal allowed to heal.

tests.name: Otoscopy
tests.result_summary: Redness midway down ear canal. Device removed to allow healing.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Refitting of extended-wear device. Larger size and lubrication used to prevent slippage during coughing.

tests.name: Refitting
tests.result_summary: Inserted larger size device with lubrication. Fit remained secure despite coughing.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Final appointment. Family training on device inspection and volume control. Patient doing very well.

tests.name: Counseling/Training
tests.result_summary: Videotaped instructions for family. Confirmed tinnitus control and improved quality of life.

proposed_items: Trial of BTE hearing aids (initially Slim-tube, then RIC).
Fit Extended-Wear Hearing Aids (deep insertion) to address dexterity and consistency issues.
Use of lubrication for device insertion to prevent dislodging during coughing fits.
Program adjustments (reduced low-frequency gain) to manage occlusion effect.
Family training on device inspection and use of magnetic volume wand.
counseling_actions: Counseling on hearing aids as 'medicine for the brain' requiring consistent use.
Education on the importance of visual cues for understanding speech.
Discussion of how medications and comorbidities (COPD, thyroid) contribute to dizziness and tinnitus.
Explanation that consistent auditory stimulation can help reduce tinnitus perception.
Use of smartphone photos to demonstrate ear canal status and device positioning to family.

escalation.rationale_short: Patient requires routine ongoing care for replacement of extended-wear devices every 7-8 weeks.

follow_up_plan.objective: Programmed replacement of the extended-wear hearing aids before battery depletion.

expected_outcome: Patient reports tinnitus is controlled and dizziness has subsided.
Improved communication and overall quality of life reported by patient and family.
Family reports patient is more optimistic, confident, and demonstrates improved cognitive abilities.
